I

inCheck - Variable in class chess.ChessBoard
Tells whether either player is in check
initializeRow(int, ChessPiece.Color) - Method in class chess.ChessBoard
initializeRow is a helper function of setBoard which sets the non pawn pieces on the board.
isCheck(ChessPiece.Color) - Method in class chess.ChessBoard
isCheck determines if the passed players king is in Check.
isCheckMate(ChessPiece.Color) - Method in class chess.ChessBoard
isCheckMate checks if the passed player is in checkmate.
isPathToKing(int, int) - Method in class chess.ChessBoard
isPathToKing checks if a given piece has a valid move to the enemies king.
isSpotAttackable(ChessPiece.Color, int, int) - Method in class chess.ChessBoard
isSpotAttackable checks if a given space can be attacked by an enemy.
isValidMove(int, int, int, int, ChessPiece[][]) - Method in class chess.Bishop
isValidMove for bishop checks in what diagonal direction the piece is trying to move.
isValidMove(int, int, int, int, ChessPiece.Color) - Method in class chess.ChessBoard
isValidMove is the main function in checking if any given input is valid.
isValidMove(int, int, int, int, ChessPiece[][]) - Method in class chess.ChessPiece
isValidMove is an abstract function to be overwritten by each child that inherits ChessPiece.
isValidMove(int, int, int, int, ChessPiece[][]) - Method in class chess.King
isValidMove in King is never used, but is declared to satisfy inheriting the abstract function
isValidMove(int, int, int, int, ChessPiece[][]) - Method in class chess.Knight
The knights isValidMove does not stop if enemy pieces are in its path, as the knight is allowed to hop over other pieces.
isValidMove(int, int, int, int, ChessPiece[][]) - Method in class chess.Pawn
Pawn isValidMove does a few checks.
isValidMove(int, int, int, int, ChessPiece[][]) - Method in class chess.Queen
The Queen isValidMove function is a combination of the rook and bishop isValidMove checks.
isValidMove(int, int, int, int, ChessPiece[][]) - Method in class chess.Rook
Rook isValidMove checks if the desired location is reachable by moving in the cardinal directions centered on the rook.
